intro: Cayratia strigosa, commonly known as the silver vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a distinctive velvety texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, round berries that turn red when mature. This plant is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
